Beef Tenderloin Sliders

Jump to Recipe

Are you ready to elevate your next gathering with a mouthwatering dish that will please crowds and delight taste buds? Look no further than our delicious Beef Tenderloin Sliders! These sliders are not only a perfect finger food for parties, but they also deliver a gourmet experience packed into a small bun. Made with tender beef tenderloin, fresh toppings, and melty cheddar cheese, each slider is a burst of flavor that combines the rich taste of premium beef with the crunch of fresh vegetables. Whether you’re hosting a backyard barbecue, a game day party, or simply looking for a quick weeknight dinner, these sliders are versatile and easy to prepare. In this recipe, we'll walk you through every step to ensure your sliders are a hit! Get ready to impress your guests with this tantalizing treat!

Ingredients

beef tenderloin

Choose a well-marbled cut for the best flavor and tenderness. If unavailable, you can substitute with filet mignon or sirloin steak. Make sure to let the beef come to room temperature before cooking to ensure even cooking.

slider buns

Opt for soft, fresh buns for the best texture. If you want a healthier option, consider whole wheat or gluten-free buns. You can also use mini brioche buns for a richer flavor.

salt

Use kosher salt for even seasoning. If you want to enhance the flavor further, consider using smoked salt for a subtle smokiness.

black pepper

Freshly ground black pepper has a more robust flavor than pre-ground. If you enjoy a bit of heat, consider adding a pinch of cayenne or using freshly cracked pepper.

olive oil

Extra virgin olive oil can enhance the flavor of your beef, but for higher heat cooking, consider using light olive oil or avocado oil which has a higher smoke point.

cheddar cheese

Sharp cheddar will provide a more pronounced flavor. If you want to mix it up, consider using pepper jack for a kick or gouda for a creamier texture. Make sure to let the cheese melt on the hot beef for a few seconds before assembling.

lettuce

Romaine or iceberg lettuce will add a nice crunch. For a twist, use arugula for a peppery flavor or spinach for a milder taste.

tomato

Choose ripe, seasonal tomatoes for the best flavor. Beefsteak tomatoes provide a juicy bite, while heirloom varieties can add visual appeal and unique taste. Slice them just before assembling to prevent sogginess.

pickles

Dill pickles are classic, but consider using bread and butter pickles for sweetness or even pickled jalapeños for added spice. You can also make quick pickles at home for a fresher taste.

ketchup

Try gourmet or homemade ketchup for a more unique flavor. You can also mix in some sriracha or hot sauce for a spicy kick.

mustard

Dijon mustard adds a nice tang, but you can also use yellow mustard for a classic taste. For something different, consider whole grain mustard for texture or honey mustard for sweetness.

Cooking Steps

  • Step 1: Preheat the Grill or Skillet

    Start by preheating your grill or stovetop skillet over medium-high heat. This ensures that your beef tenderloin will sear properly, locking in the juices.

  • Step 2: Season the Beef Tenderloin

    Generously season your 1 lb beef tenderloin with salt and black pepper. Use freshly ground black pepper for a more robust flavor. This step is crucial for enhancing the natural flavors of the beef.

  • Step 3: Add Olive Oil

    Add 2 tablespoons of olive oil to your preheated grill or skillet. This will help create a nice sear on the beef, giving it a delicious crust.

  • Step 4: Sear the Tenderloin

    Place the seasoned tenderloin onto the grill or skillet. Sear for about 4-5 minutes on each side for medium-rare, or until it reaches your desired doneness. Use a meat thermometer to check for doneness: 130°F for medium-rare, 140°F for medium.

  • Step 5: Rest the Meat

    Once cooked, remove the tenderloin from heat and let it rest for a few minutes. Resting allows the juices to redistribute throughout the meat, making it more tender and flavorful.

  • Step 6: Prepare the Slider Buns

    Slice the 8 slider buns in half. If you prefer, toast them lightly on the grill or in a toaster for added texture and warmth.

  • Step 7: Assemble the Sliders

    On the bottom half of each bun, place a slice of the sliced beef. Add a slice of cheddar cheese, a handful of lettuce, a slice of tomato, and a few pickles. This layering not only adds flavor but also creates a visually appealing slider.

  • Step 8: Add Condiments

    Drizzle your sliders with ketchup and mustard to taste. Feel free to get creative with other condiments like BBQ sauce or aioli for a unique twist.

  • Step 9: Top and Serve

    Place the top half of the bun on each slider. Serve immediately while warm, and enjoy the delicious flavors of your homemade beef tenderloin sliders!

Frequently Asked Questions

How do I prepare beef tenderloin for cooking?

Start by trimming any excess fat from the tenderloin. Pat it dry with paper towels to ensure a good sear. Then, season it generously with salt and black pepper before cooking.

What is the best way to cook beef tenderloin?

For beginners, searing on a grill or stovetop skillet is a great option. Preheat your grill or skillet to medium-high heat, add olive oil, and cook the tenderloin for 4-5 minutes on each side until your desired doneness.

How can I tell when the beef is cooked to my liking?

Use a meat thermometer: 125°F for rare, 135°F for medium-rare, and 145°F for medium. If you don’t have one, you can also gauge doneness by pressing the meat; it should feel firm but slightly springy for medium-rare.

Should I let the beef rest after cooking?

Yes! Letting the beef rest for about 5-10 minutes after cooking allows the juices to redistribute, making it more tender and flavorful when sliced.

What can I use if I don’t have slider buns?

You can use any small bread rolls, mini bagels, or even lettuce wraps for a low-carb option. Just ensure they are small enough to hold the filling.

How do I assemble the sliders?

Slice the toasted buns in half, place a piece of cooked beef on the bottom half, add a slice of cheddar cheese, then layer with lettuce, tomato, and pickles. Finish with ketchup and mustard, and cover with the top half of the bun.

What if I’m unsure about seasoning?

Start with a light sprinkle of salt and pepper and taste as you go. You can always add more, but you can’t take it away once it’s in!

How can I make my sliders healthier?

You can opt for whole grain slider buns, add more vegetables like avocado or grilled onions, and use leaner cuts of beef or turkey for the patties.

What should I do if I don’t have a grill or skillet?

You can also cook the tenderloin in the oven. Preheat to 400°F, place the seasoned tenderloin on a baking sheet, and roast for about 20-25 minutes or until it reaches your desired doneness.

How can I keep my kitchen safe while cooking?

Always use pot holders when handling hot surfaces, keep knives pointed down when carrying them, and wash your hands and surfaces frequently to avoid cross-contamination.

Additional Information

Dietary Considerations

For gluten-free options, use gluten-free slider buns or lettuce wraps. To cater to those who prefer a leaner meat option, substitute the beef tenderloin with turkey or a plant-based protein like a black bean patty. Additionally, for a dairy-free option, omit the cheddar cheese or use a dairy-free cheese alternative.

Pairings

For an ideal pairing, serve the Beef Tenderloin Sliders with crispy sweet potato fries or a side of coleslaw for a refreshing crunch. As for beverages, a bold red wine such as a Cabernet Sauvignon or a Malbec complements the richness of the beef. For a non-alcoholic option, consider a homemade lemonade or a craft soda to balance the flavors.

Serving Suggestions

Serve the sliders warm on a wooden platter or a rustic serving board for a casual and inviting presentation. Garnish the platter with fresh herbs like parsley or arugula for added color. Provide a variety of condiments on the side, such as spicy aioli or barbecue sauce, to allow guests to customize their sliders. Consider adding a small side salad with a tangy vinaigrette to refresh the palate.

Beef Tenderloin Sliders

25 min
$25
350 kcal
Difficulty: 30%
Servings: 8

Allergens:

Tags:

Description

Juicy beef tenderloin sliders topped with fresh toppings and served on soft buns, perfect for a crowd.

Ingredients

  • beef tenderloin: 1 lb
  • slider buns: 8
  • salt: to taste
  • black pepper: to taste
  • olive oil: 2 tbsp
  • cheddar cheese: 4 slices
  • lettuce: 1 cup
  • tomato: 1, sliced
  • pickles: 1/2 cup
  • ketchup: to taste
  • mustard: to taste
